findings.title: Reentrancy via modifier external call
findings.explanation: The supportsToken modifier makes an external call to msg.sender before the token balance is updated, allowing a malicious contract to re-enter airDrop and collect tokens multiple times in one transaction.
findings.fix_suggestion: Follow the Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern: update tokenBalance[msg.sender] before any external calls or introduce a reentrancy guard (e.g., nonReentrant modifier) to prevent nested calls.

findings.title: Insecure authorization via supportsToken modifier
findings.explanation: The supportsToken modifier trusts any contract at msg.sender that implements a supportsToken function returning the correct hash, allowing attackers to spoof this check and invoke airDrop.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a whitelist or registry of authorized token-supporting contracts or restrict the check to a known address instead of universally trusting msg.sender; avoid relying on unverified external calls for authorization.
